We'll go back to try more of the dishes. Overall the menu seems inspired by Venezuelan-Columbian and other Latin classics but takes a lot of liberties that are interesting, but may stray too far from the original for some of us that love those classics in their native form. We'd definitely go back for another opportunity to try more of the dishes. It is very pleasurable to see real creativity and a bit of culinary risk-taking in downtown Phoenix!

AipMACoDNHzI5fWZAIKUVg.text: Went there for lunch with a business guest.  Service was excellent and menu was not the typical lunch menu.  Restaurant is excellent for entertaining people from outside the United States.  Will definitely go back.

0YD24fRpAbb3e_3t2kQ81Q.text: We visited Province on a Friday night and the place was not very busy.  I like places that have a lot of action and this was not one of them. Downtown Phoenix has a long way to go.  Food was great! Crowd not so much.  If this review was based on the food alone I would give it 4-5 stars but ambience is huge.  Their patio was pretty nice even though it was way too hot to sit outside.  One annoying thing about Phoenix restaurants is they keep it freezing inside but then it's too hot to sit outside.  Isn't there a happy medium???

9nJX4tPYpMi5N5fKjG-x5g.text: What a great restaurant.  My friend and I went there on Friday night for dinner and to see the Flamenco dancers.  They were excellent-- interacted with the crowds that came to see them, but the restaurant was what was exciting.  I have eaten at many restaurants and never have I had the level of service I had at Province, inside the Westin.  The manager fixed our table so we could have the best view of the dancers, and interact with them.  Also, they gave us happy hour prices on the wine, because they were a little short staffed when we first arrived, and so we had to wait to order our wine and it was after happy hour.  They had a special event so they had a lot more people there than usual.  The server was attentive.  We both had the fish stew, oh it was good and not too filling, plus we shared a side of polenta and we shared the beef skewer an excellent appetizer to share.  When we finished our meal we were full but not overly so.  The dinner tab was reasonable.  We had the shared appetizer, two glasses of wine each,  the fish stew, and the shared polenta all for $35.00 each, which included the wonderful dancers and the great guitarist.  I would call this place a sleeper, in that it has to be one of the best dinner spots in downtown Phoenix for the price.

mloY_zhrAOVSHD0QbUFMzQ.text: Let me say right off the bat that my low-ish rating has nothing to do with the food, which was great.  DH and I both had wonderful meals -- my shrimp and grits was maybe the best I've ever had and the asparagus with preserved lemon was also wonderful.  The portions (one small plate and one "smaller" entree) were just right and the prices very reasonable for the quality of the food.  The decor has been commented on and I don't have much to add except that I didn't find it cold -- in fact I really liked it.  The service was generally good EXCEPT . . . and here's the reason for my lower rating:  I am gluten-intolerant and asked our server about several dishes, all of which she advised me to avoid.  When it came to dessert I specifically asked about one item, she said that it had gluten ingredients, so I "settled" for ice cream.  Who would ever think (I didn't, but the server should know) that inside this tiny scoop of ice cream was something that was suspiciously like a piece of cookie.  Fortunately my gluten intolerance isn't of the serious, Celiac variety, where I would be very sick for a week from just a taste of something containing gluten, but it's enough that I'll be uncomfortable for a couple of days.  When I told the server what I found, she was very apologetic, someone senior (one of the chefs?) came out and apologized and they took my ice cream off our bill.  They probably should have comped the entire meal (or at least our drinks) but I wimped out and didn't insist.  Just be aware, if you have an issue with gluten, that the servers are not educated about the menu items and you need to insist that they ask the kitchen about any item about which you are not absolutely certain.  It's an issue that has the possibility of being sufficiently serious that they should know about this stuff and, while I can chalk some of it up to opening-week-learning-curve, it's pretty inexcusable.  Without that one issue, it would probably be at least a 4-star, maybe a 5.

TYSQtPjD_lMSW0AWR9GIhA.text: Well, we headed out to snoop out the new restaurant at the newest downtown hotel, the Westin.  Now, I can be a tough critic, not as much from a food standpoint but more so from a service standpoint.  We went in not really knowing if we would stay for dinner; wanted to scope out the menu first.  The menu gave a good appearance and the outdoor patio was more than inviting.  So, we decided to give it a a shot and asked for a table.  Our server, Drew, was off the charts fantastic.  Very professional and was there to make sure our visit was worthwhile.  Our drinks were exceptional and the food was truly fantastic.  The patio with the downtown views really helped to make this place a contender for one of the best venues in our downtown restaurant scene.  It's right on the metro line and easy access to all of downtown  The martinis were a ten, the food including the asparagus salad, the ahi tuna tacos and the pounded chicken breast were all 9+ on a scale of 1 - 10.  We will be back for sure!

xt4M--3-psqFW8d0MmU7jQ.text: Great shrimp and Steak Tacos. Washed it down with a Ketel and Sprite. Great service. Good Ambiance. Nice spot to grab a drink after work. Not too packed. Reasonable pricing.

GXL4Xtb7rgsxIHpvMFgEMw.text: What a pleasant surprise!    My wife and I were looking for something new, something fresh, while at the same time welcoming and inviting,  Province was all of the above.    We were only going to stop in for a drink and check the place out, but Kyle the bartender insisted that we have a seat at his bar and at least try a small bite or appetizer.... we ended up having a four course meal (and loved every bit of it).  He was very knowledgeable with the menu which helped tremedously because we had many questions and he makes a GREAT martini as well!!  But he also made us a pimlico grid (specialty cocktail), being a recommendation of his.  It is now a recommendation for you from me!  Anywho, the dining room is comfortable, the patio is unlike any I have seen downtown, with a great combination of fire and water (you will have to check it out for yourself).  The staff is very inviting and I plan on coming back very soon!

JLKBIqjjqDtRIsZewDzlvQ.text: Went to Province with a group of colleagues, so there was 8 of us.  It sits just off the lobby of the hotel with the bar almost in the lobby.  While not very busy on the night we went, the food and service was excellent.  We shared the Goat Cheese Appy, and two different flat breads.  Awesome.  Not a huge Wine by the Glass list, but the selection was great and even had a very reasonable house (I did not have).  Everyone loved their entrees and one of the best things is that some entrees can be had in half portions; a great value.  Beware of the Skirt Steak if you don't like spicy.  It's hot!!  All in all, a great experience.  I'll come back for sure.

LK3ZsoVtbRXv4SAkc5D3Yg.text: Brunch.  Beautiful restaurant, really good service. Mediocre food. We had a party of 6 and they were able to seat us right away, we had mimosas and Bloody Marys... the Marys were good the mimosas were light on the champagne, too much orange juice. We ordered appetizers... chicken skewers, juicy and flavorful, steak bites were very yummy some pieces were a little fatty but it was cooked nicely and the rub was great. The house made potato chips were light and crispy and yummy. The fruit plate was really nice, could've used more yogurt but I probably could have asked for some if it came down to it. The pastry basket was just ok. The corned beef was very very crispy and a little on the salty side so some might prefer it that way, but unless you order it extra crispy I don't think it should automatically come this way. The omelette was okay nothing to write home about, the breakfast potatoes were way overdone they were very very very crispy and tasted of oil. Turkey sausage and egg whites.... How do you mess that up. Here is where the real disappointment was.... The Croque Madame. They have no right calling it that because it is nothing like a croque madame. There's not a shred of Gruyere on the plate nothing has been broiled the bread is soggy and mushy, and the eggs still had a lot of raw white and the bechamel was flavorless and pointless. Do not order this meal there. It is terrible. It is nothing like a croque madame. Province is going to need to step their food game up if they want to survive with the locals.

obX67ZJh9_YLa4SCt0unkw.text: Went here on a date...I had the salmon, which was excellent. The service was great (but it was pretty dead, so it should be). We also had the goat cheese fondue...I liked it though I thought it might have been better with something besides the herb crackers which seemed a bit salty. Also the cheese got cold quite fast, so something to keep it warm might have been good as well. But overall the experience was great.

76OM3_F_zBF-t8hE0Y3CeA.text: Decided to try out this one for breakfast with some out of town guest.  Hummmmm...  Definitely overpriced!!!  A two egg breakfast was $20 ... Four for breakfast was $80 and one in my party did not even eat we shared a fruit plate... Definitely not worth the money and since we were the only table in the dining room you would have expected the service staff to be falling over each other to wait on our table... NOT.  Don't think i will be returning and will not recommend to anyone else... Good Luck!

wfIG4-OZ75fPY1xplaAtZw.text: Went here for brunch because we had a voucher. Overall I was impressed by our meal. My husband and I ate outside on the patio which was very pleasant.  We ordered coffee (3.5) and I ordered a Bloody Mary  which was a little on the spicy side but tasted fresh and my husband ordered a mimosa ($6 each). We shared the seasonal fruit plate which has a nice variety of fruit  including strawberries, cantaloupe, honeydew, blueberries, blackberries, and pineapples, but the melon was not ripe and some strawberries were over ripe ($8). I ordered the corned beef benedict ($11) and my husband ordered the classic benedict ($12). The corned beef was a little dry, but I should have expected that! The hollandaise was tart. Best breakfast potatoes I have ever had! We made a reservation per our voucher request but the place was almost empty. I was disappointed that the Westin does not have complementary parking for its guests.

GPN3ncMBahTMa3sNQO5blw.text: Doing the Phoenix Urban Wine Walk.  Walked 8 blocks in temps of 104 to Provence @ the Westin Hotel for the advertised beef kabobs.  They ran out at 3pm; event goes till 6.  Poor planning.  I won't be coming back!

ECFqjkuRVJPdaTIuWyMGnQ.text: Stopped in at Province while staying at the Westin for meetings. I was a little worried because of the neon pink on the walls but from the minute I walked through the door I felt like I was at a restaurant that I'd been a regular at. Both the hostess, Amanda, and the server, Kyle, were excellent. Food was good, steak cooked perfectly. Will definitely be back.

9HYgJP0W8IU8ViPa3UozmA.text: Tasty tapas and unique Latin flavors. A little pricey but you don't feel like you're in Phoenix out on the patio which is a plus.

XN8Rt_gDEeff3Hlx5XRfxw.text: Went there last night for AZ Restaurant week and LOVED it!  My husband and I went with another couple and we all got the Retaurant week menu and also opted for the optional wine/cocktail pairing.  Everything was awesome, including the service, though, it had a slow start in the bar.  Not sure what the delay was but it took a while to get someone to come take our order so we coud enjoy some cocktails before dinner.  Once we were seated for dinner, our server Emily took great care of us.  We started with a choice of a cocktail, i enjoyed the mojito and my husband tried the pina colada.  Both were excellent.  Our first course was the roasted plantain and pumpkin soup with a poblano crema; it was delicious!  The next course was the arroz con pollo which again was very tasty.  Next came a wonderfully cooked and seasoned pork chop and tasty yucca black bean cake with a small bed of greens.  And lastly a coconut cream flan with a rum glaze.  (The wine pairings were very good as well.)  This is the third time I have dined at Province and always it is wonderful meal and great service.  Our friends were so pleased (it was their first time) that they are already planning a return trip.  Hope you check out Province for yourself!

PKv9e4QcAdFKJEbZnS1e5Q.text: Other reviewers commented on "hit or miss" food; we had big "misses." The cheese fondue was ok, sandwiches were inedible. Today's special crabcake sandwich tasted like imitation (or just old) crab meat.  The chicken sandwich looked unappetising, and tasted worse.    The atmosphere was 4 or 5 star, the valet was prompt and polite, the patio looked like a comfortable place for drinks, and the service was great.  (In fact, the server expressed genuine concern when we asked her to clear our barely touched plates.)  We'd go back for drinks, but won't order food again.

vFsVmHBlj0rg8KRVwQwW1w.text: The ambiance is kind of hotel restauranty but the food is very good! We started with Queen Creek warm olives and Valencia style shrimp. Both were excellent. And then our waitress brought out a great cornbread muffin with chipotle butter. We shared the skirt steak which was cooked perfectly with an awesome chimichurri on top. Service was awesome and they have a great wine selection. Overall, an excellent dinner!

DKU2ilOIsjuzeyg5yr2bkw.text: I've been here a few times since they opened (i live next door), and have always had amazing food, drink and service....untill (Que Law and Order Theme Music here) last Sunday night. When Alissa (the manager) is there, its a well run machine. Greeted politely, seated immediately, waited on perfectly. Sunday was the first time we went in, and she wasn't there (the on duty front desk mgr ((get to that shortly)) said she had worked the past 10 days in a row and deserved a night off; no question!). We were seated immediately on the wonderful patio, between the water fall and the fire pit. ordered drinks and apps, all came out fast and amazing as always. However, after an hour and 10 minutes of waiting for our main dishes we were beyond livid at our Stoned Out waiter. he seriously must have been in the back playing guitar and yanking on his curly white boy hair. we never saw him and when we did he continued to make excuse after excuse. At one point, he said they were plating our food....43 minutes later we saw him again. Then he blamed "the 14 top that was just seated"...um really? they were eating when we walked in; and they were THE ONLY ones in the entire place!!! When we Finlay broke down, and asked for a mgr, he immediately came over (Chris i believe) and asked what was going on. 2 minutes into the conversation, he said "stop, let me get this handled" and went to get it handled. our food arrived, along with out POS waiter who didn't say a single word. he just sat our food down, and left, never to be seen again. Chris came back over, and told us our entire meal was comped (all martinis, sodas, apps, entrees', everything!). I understand bad seeds. The only reason I'm still at a 5 star is because of the management, the normal service, and the food is beyond tasty. But, be warned of 2 things: you will pay a premium for the quality (worth every penny to me as long as hippie isn't your Waiter) and 2, if a white boy with curly hair and Cashed eyes is your Waiter, move seats out of his section. If i see him when i go back, my review will drop to 4 stars. Alissa, please smack him around a bit.

tu-IPK6OxB376lI3GRydBA.text: Usually when I restaurant is in a hotel, I will step away and go somewhere else - This was the exception, and thank goodness we stayed.  From the moment we sat down, the staff was attentive, but not hoovering.  We were served a little taste, before we even had a chance to look at the menu and then got excited to look at the menu.  Everything from the "little starter taste", to the pear salad, to the salmon, (and when everything else is that good, you HAVE to do dessert!)  Our server recommended the stack cake - which was also amazing.    You could be dressed up or casual - either way was okay.  We dined outside to enjoy the balmy evening - Great atmosphere, quiet, did not seem like a "hotel restaurant" - can hardly wait for my next trip to Phoenix to dine there again.

SWs4bNlQ6l9O5deSfWe8EQ.text: We had a quick lunch as part of a business meeting and hoped to find a new choice for downtown.  The service was attentive as the restaurant was nearly empty (at 11:45 am), but our server knew next to nothing about the menu items.  He also seemed incapable of making eye contact, which was just odd.  The lentil soup was very good, though the portion was also very small.  I coupled that with a flat bread that was somewhat bland.  My guest had a chopped salad that she had to send back once.  When it came out again, it was fine, but nothing about it stood out.  All in all, it seems like your standard hotel restaurant--eat there if you're stuck in the building, but get out if you're not.

xUY6J_8l6vW7W3BHUS7j_A.text: Just moved to Downtown Phoenix and went for some cocktails on Thursday night with 2 friend s and had a great time.  The bartender and drinks were fantastic plus with how busy it was the service was great.  I went back on Saturday for breakfast and that experience was great also.  I had the breakfast tacos and my friend had the ham & eggs which was served fast and hot.

SyIeMndrI9htWUn9_vLjng.text: Priceless!  The only reason they get 2 stars is that the green salad was fresh and delicious!  The reason they should not have gotten 2 stars...the server spilled my wine in my salad....brought me a new salad immediately but never offered to replace the spilled wine....really?

Wv7z67TrbpFIjfYsCuTiJQ.text: Went with my honey last Friday night - fantastic. Chris Jacome was playing his incredible flamenco music while his wife Lena danced, which was amazing (they are great and will be there every Friday evening thru July!). Our waiter Kyle was awesome and left us wanting for nothing the whole night. The food was delicious. I think we may have to go back next Friday... Thanks for a perfect night!

krCb4bzUUpCFrRrnYkl3vQ.text: Just had a great dinner here. Food was made just right. Service was excellent. Great free welcome items. Good homemade bread. And place was almost empty. Prices quite fair for this quality.

ud8yZM9Cj42bMKfcaPyCKg.text: Really, really, really slow service for a week night. Took us 2 - 1/2 hours to eat. Came here with a party of 12 and the waitress was missing most of the time. I had the scallops and it was ridiculously spicy

5WTBFPnoSAkiBaQ_dlDEtg.text: The food is great, but the service is slow. After we finished our entrees, we asked for the dessert and the check to come at the same time, because we were in a hurry. The check came in 3 minutes, but the dessert - another 15+ minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ruby red trout
Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seared scallops

od0U7Qc9wZfXXNtz-YniKQ.text: Location:  5 Service:  5 Menu:  4 Environment: 4 Overall:  5  I had breakfast at about 8:00 am on a Wednesday morning.  Province Urban Kitchen & Bar is situated close to public transportation options like the bus or light rail.  There is an enclosed courtyard to welcome you to the hotel grounds.  Look for signs to guide you to the restaurant.  I entered from the east after taking the light rail and found the restaurant without any delays.  Location: 5  I was greeted immediately upon entry.  The host acknowledged me and did not acknowledge my service dog.  This level of professionalism is not common in the year I have lived in the Phoenix metro area.  Most places will pay attention to her and neglect that I am the customer.  I first met Krystle who offered me water and was also the barista that morning.  I asked her to make me her favorite caffeinated beverage.  She brought me a latte with foam so fluffy it reminded me of looking at cumulus clouds.  My server was Christina.  I ordered the Buddha Bowl because of its variety of ingredients and that it was a vegetarian option.  It was delicious and came out promptly.  Service:  5  The menu selection is adequate.  I was able to review it online before I got there and had in mind what I wanted.  The menu is built for those who have a focused breakfast appetite and may want to eat and run.  The price may be appropriate for the alignment to a hotel like WestIn, I found it a slightly high for the portion size and presentation of my dish.  Menu:  4  The environment was inviting.  There is a HUGE picture of the Phoenix light rail train on the eastern wall.  The rest of the interior design felt canned and missed an opportunity to include local art to create a more unique feel to the restaurant.  There is appropriate space between the tables so that you are not bumping into others as you are seated or leaving.  Environment:  4  Overall:  Province is a place to stop by and check out.  Whether you are living and working downtown or passing through while you visit this city, I recommend you visit this restaurant.  This place is for those wanting a change in standard fare and environment who can dine in or order to go.  And try out the Buddha Bowl, I think you'll like it!

voobvNvMX39gSJVLz_OO1A.text: Wow over an hour waiting for food that never came. Perhaps it was out of the ordinary for this place from what I have read but we were not the only table to get up and leave after an hour tonight waiting.  So disappointed

QkvF4YIDdww-DEzgKPTz3Q.text: Had many meals here during a work trip.  Staff was attentive, food was delicious, and drinks were great.  Ask Emily to make you a Manhattan, she made me my first one and it was excellent!

CqUYXDbCZt5FcFZo4Xz4lQ.text: The lobby bar is a PERFECT spot for a nice snack and dessert on a Friday night. The new decor is a welcome addition to the downtown scene.  Try the Sticky Banana Bread Pudding, with the Plantation Rum Ice Cream. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.

mJ1iKpvHXITXLDmqoyz60Q.text: Came in for restaurant week to try some of their top dishes and I was blown away! The flavor, presentation and variety was top notch. Everything about the food was perfect, down to the bread and butter on the table. Attention to detail is incredible here. I also tried one of the signature cocktails, the Lost Dutchman, and I enjoyed it so much more than I thought I would. I don't normally order signature cocktails because I don't like sweet and too many flavors to confuse my taste buds, but the balance was incredible! Last but absolutely not least, my server Karen was wonderful. She made sure everything was great, my courses were timed perfectly and gave the customer attention needed without being overbearing, as I have experienced at so many other restaurants. Definitely ask for her if you try this establishment for the first time (or any time!). Dinner will go smooth and you'll leave with a smile on your face. I sure did! Can't wait to go back and try more of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lost Dutchman
Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mesquite Swordfish

YTJnxHGpYn6pDmKXqiB9Lg.text: Good hotel bar. They serve lots of Arizona crafted beer.

yJWWQaJCvNNY7TkKf04eqg.text: Good food inside the Westin Hotel. Small but good menu and prices are fair. The coffee was very good and the home fries were over the moon.

RbFLn9Q2cl3PvTTaRWSvJQ.text: Province is located inside the Westin Phoenix Downtown hotel. I had two meals at Province - lunch the first day and breakfast the second day.  For lunch I sat at the bar and I ordered a spicy tomato soup and the W.P.D. Cobb Salad - which included: Avocado, applewood bacon, cucumber, egg, tomato, blue cheese, house-made ranch dressing, and sliced grilled chicken. The soup was outstanding! I could have drank a gallon of it! The salad was solid - nothing special.  Lunch was greatly marred by the fact that the fire alarm system went off when it was not supposed to. Apparently they were testing the system elsewhere in the hotel - but it went off downstairs. It went on and on and on - until I had a throbbing headache. I was about to get up and walk out - but just then they finally turned it off.  I ended up having to go down some Tylenol with an iced coffee to get rid of the headache. Nice going Westin hotel staff.  The next morning for breakfast - I decided to try the Corned Beef Hash - which features House-made corned beef, poached eggs, topped with a grained mustard hollandaise. Plus coffee, water, and V-8 juice. It was outstanding! Delicious! Yummy!  Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dieIX3IZm5G9LUgUGv6vjQ.text: Nice stopover on the way to a Herberger show. Good crowd. Great menu and drinks options.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16 taps! Not bad for a hotel bar. Great local options.

Vyked3ayY2dHbL7capnXnQ.text: Top notch restaurant, our first time there the food is excellent so is th the service. I would put it in the top 5 for downtown dinning. I would recommend to all that go to the theater, you get a dinner discount.

LJqt0G74F5z8y1DvkXLTNA.text: My wife picked this place for a family dinner. Inasmuch as it was in a hotel, I was skeptical. Once we arrived I noticed that The menu was a bit limited and I found myself searching for something I would like. I even got fidgety. I then ordered the swordfish as did two others, someone had the trout and others had the cauliflower steak. Surprise. The food was OUTSTANDING. Really outstanding. As in memorable. Service was great. Ambiance nice, nothing special but still I would highly recommend.

fCsQBgZFauQAJULGQJ9Lgg.text: Got the blue corn and shrimp grits, mesquite swordfish, and filet mignon. Everything was spot on with our palettes. They create such beautifully placed dishes with wonderfully complex flavors, I'm an Arizona native and don't think I've ever been to a restaurant that develops their food to such a high caliber. That being said, not for those who like simple soul food. The portions are smaller but the complex flavors were more than enough for me to feel satiated.

bJDkKH9fDmi2GHzESPBUZA.text: Of the three restaurants I visited in Phoenix during my conference, this was the best - and it was in my hotel. I actually visited it 5 times! First was to have a wonderful peanut butter stout. Next was to have dinner: cauliflower croquettes, beef cheek on blue corn polenta, and pork three ways. Outstanding! Third time was for lunch: Sonoran Caesar Salad. Not as special as it sounds, but they did bring me extra dressing (which was needed). Fourth was to use my drink ticket for a Holiday in Jerez - fantastic! Fifth was for breakfast - the green chili pork chilaquiles, very nice. All the foods I had featured a little tip of the hat to the regional flavors, especially pepper and corn. Do yourself a favor and spare some time away from the convention go-to pubs to check this place out.

EYp0CalR4MhUqWYmns_T6g.text: Went to province urban kitchen on the urban L trip. Love the sour beer they had there. The chili Quiles were on point as well. The music performer was really good. It was a beautiful day in the outdoor seating was nice. We will definitely come back on a different occasion. Four out of five stars.

64zQy9TNk4YfhZSKZcLWlg.text: Great patio atmosphere, wonderful drinks and the service from Elijah was exceptional. Highly recommend stopping in for a cocktail.

9WyOh20hSYN8ofxgDJybRQ.text: Service was terrible and it wasn't busy, however the food was really good.  My favorite was the churro dessert. Very good! If I lived here I'd go back.

7O9FbuKBr4m4_QQ62cZ1Vg.text: Innovative food, Best "Croque Madame" I have ever had, and a very kind and accomidsring staff.  Bartenders Nick and Alex are amazing and remember your drinks and name from day 1.  Gladys the Food and Beverage manager was above and beyond. Come here weather or not you are staying at the Westin and you won't be disappointed .

0c3W4L1Ktwnogc6BgA_DkA.text: Arriving for dinner at 6:30pm on a Sunday evening, I was a little bit nervous when I walked in because the dining room was empty... except for 3-4 tables with people dining alone.   Then it hit me, it was the restaurant for the Westin, so it made a little more sense.  The dining room was beautiful and "loungy"... had an upscale 60's Vegas vibe.     I was a bit disappointed that the lighting wasn't more dim to make it a more elegant dining experience, but the rest of the evening made up for it.  Our server was beyond friendly and delightful.  She was very attentive, but not overbearing.     The wine selection was quite nice... I didn't look at the cocktail menu specifically, but it seemed as though they had a nice variety.  We ordered the meat/cheese plate as an appetizer and it was perfect for two people.     For dinner, I had the 6oz filet and it was cooked beautifully as medium.  Crispy onions on top with beautiful fingerling potatoes and mushrooms.   My friend was able to have hers the way it was intended, with roasted tomatoes, which probably added to the flavor, but my tomato allergy restricted that for me.   All and all it was a very tasty dish.  We shared a beautiful pot de creme for dessert and it was something that we agreed we both would have had our own because it was that good!  I imagine it's hard for a restaurant to survive in downtown Phoenix, but also being part of a hotel, makes it harder to fill up, but.............   It would be a great option if you're going to a show or the theater downtown!  Also, they had a beautiful outdoor patio, which I would have loved if it weren't into the low 50's by the time I arrived.   It's hard to see from the street - the signage isn't obvious, but if you take advantage of the Westin parking lot/valet service, Province will validate your ticket!

a1gxPdX6FH6tmwQFBsPxrA.text: 4 of us had dinner last nite in the courtyard and it was exceptional. Great environment, hint of city life outside, sound of water, and really exceptional food! Havana pork excellent, asparagus salad outrageous, halibut tasty, and our waiter Sam is one of the very Best. He's beginning a career as a singer and so you you get to Provinc while he's still there

yZ0gTjvJzpti_HMJbQ5bYg.text: I enjoyed reading the dinner menu and the food sounded like it would be good...  I just never got a chance to eat any as no one ever came to wait on me after I was seated, so  I left.  I ended up getting some truly awful food at some place a few blocks away, but at least the service was good...

Y25olsGqXcrrOIrddX4QPQ.text: My first Elite event! Completely awesome. The staff was incredibly nice and friendly, I looooved the beef kabob and the mini cupcakes. Cream cheese frosting tasted just like mom's (tough to do). Very delicious. I personally was not feeling either of the soups, but oh well! Had a smashing good time, can't wait to go back.

YrkpbP-gj9Q-Y_1eZ7OhoA.text: Facility is beautiful.  Flavors are creative and unusual, with a stunning presentation.  Warm, attentive and skilled service. Interesting Latin music was a little loud for my taste, though.  My husband had the apple stack for dessert, and said it was one of the best desserts he'd ever had!  $100 for two people, with only one of us having a single glass of the least expensive wine.

qIdOgJqO4-mMGHfyF9cMuA.text: I really wanted to love this place. I had initially seen this place on groupon then read reviews and the menu and was excited to try it. Its a type of atmosphere I like in a restaurant, very modern, and nicely appointed. This ended up being one of the worst dining experiences I have had in a long time. I'm generally pretty easy to please and very forgiving of little issues of a restaurant. This place missed on just about every aspect.  We went at about 4:30 for a late lunch and happy hour. We sat in the lounge and greeted fairly promptly. Drink orders were taken. A little stingy on the pours of their wine. The Sangria, both red and white were tasty. The red Sangria had quite the kick. That was the best part of the evening. After asking for one more minute to browse the menu before ordering our server vanished. It was nearly 20 minutes before having to step up to the bar to ask to order food. We ordered a mix of items as I love to try lots of items from a new place. We ordered the burger, 2 different tacos, crab croquettes, and the meatballs. Most of which are small plate items. The tacos are very small and do not come on a white corn tortilla. I'm not quite sure what it was. I was not a fan. I hardly noticed that their was shrimp in the one taco. I only noticed from looking, it was not from tasting it. The skirt steak in the second taco was tender and flavorful. The crab croquettes and typical of bar food. You could taste the crab, not in a sweet Maryland style crab cake kind of way. It was more like a tuna fish casserole sort of taste. The burger was decent, but definitely not worthy of a $12 price tag. I have had larger Wagyu beef hamburgers for the same price that tasted so much better. The fries with the burger are good and the house made ketchup is great. The last item of what we ordered was the meatballs. Its a cute presentation with triangles of toast for dipping in the bland sauce. Unfortunately the meatballs were uncooked in the center. Not just undercooked and pink, they were RAW on the inside. I sent the dish back of course. The waitress was very apologetic and took them off the bill. As she was trying to clear the table she dropped some silverware and food at our feet. By this time she obviously was not having a good day. She brought us a complimentary dessert of a pumpkin cupcake with ice cream. The ice cream was great. The cupcake was overcooked and dry. When the bill arrived I gave my groupon and credit card to the server. The manager came back with both and apologized for bad experience and comped the whole bill. I'm not sure if I would try them again. The problems with the meal were very basic things that just should never happen at a restaurant of this level.

5-Os5dTrRSJLMKSHksqC_Q.text: Great addition to the downtown Phoenix dining scene.  We've been here several times now and each time they've varied their menu just enough to always keep our interest.  Not currently on the menu, but worth ordering is their seafood paella, with a delicious sauce featuring just a hint of coffee.  I know it sounds a bit odd, but it really works.  We've also had the empanadas and the meatballs (served in the cutest little Staub casserole).   I'm especially fond of their desserts, including the Honey Crisp stack served with Dulce de Leche ice cream and the spectacular coffee and donuts, warm little donut holes sprinkled liberally with cinnamon and sugar and served with a coffee ice cream and dark chocolate ganache ~ absolutely heavenly.  Although this is a very generous portion, if you have any dedicated chocoholics or coffee addicts in your party, you may need to order one per person, it's really that good! Lovely outdoor patio and charming staff make this one of our favorite places.

9RIJAnKMjxodUPG3tQld6A.text: Stopped over here after dinner at the Crescent Ballroom for dessert and to mainly enjoy the atmosphere. Where else can you find a cool lit waterfall in the middle of downtown?! The hostess was really nice and let us pick any table we wanted outside. There was only one other party outside but sitting near the waterfall did make it feel a bit cooler. Our waitress arrived shortly and we ordered the caramelized banana split for $8. When it arrived a short time later, its presentation was fairly fancy with one banana, split in half, caramelized (read: slightly burnt but in a good way) and one scoop of vanilla ice cream and everything covered in peanuts. While it was good, for $8 it seems like it should have been a lot more considering all those ingredients combined probably cost $1. Would it have broke the bank for two scoops? Oh well, it hit the spot and we got to enjoy the neat little patio.

Ir8SqwqCCGI5D5KxWEQgGg.text: Complimentary brunch mimosa can't be beat! Salmon benedict, Schreiner's bacon, and ham and cheese omelet was delicious too!  They use MJ English muffins...same as LGO. Yum! Great downtown spot. Put it on your list!

sMeBsUAdSoOihs0vG8_pAg.text: I too went to this establishment for AZ restaurant week and had an absolutely wonderful meal. The restaurant was quiet when we got there but that's expected the time of night we were there and it being downtown phoenix.   We had almost the exact meal as the previous reviewer so I wont bother telling you how wonderful and tasty the meal was so instead I'll tell you how accommodating the wait staff was. My wife is at the end of her 1st tri-mester and eating is something that can go any direction. Half way through dinner she felt full and didn't want to eat anymore because she wanted to try dessert. Dessert took a little while to come out but when it arrived my wife couldn't even eat a bite she started feeling quite ill and on the verge of crying I called over our waitress and explained the situation and asked if the dessert plate could be wrapped up. She was amazing and told us no problem and then came back a few minutes later with the sweet snacks.   Great evening.

yFr3UmoLqDfFityNOgFPWg.text: The patio has a nice vibe and we were seated. Craft beer and extensive wine list was yum. The menu though..really needs work.  Beet salad. fried veggies and calamari, salmon with lentils, chicken ala boring. The menu was just so...limited.  If we were not famished we would have looked for another place, but the valet had already parked us.  Complimentary valet service was nice. I ordered a vegetarian black bean burger. It came with fries, but I substituted for fruit. The fruit bowl was huge, but the fruit was day-old melon.  My friend had a boring chicken sandwich. Grilled and tossed across a bun..just blah.  We were confused on wait staff-who was serving us? Three people came by. They were confused with fetching a little ketchup for me to try and spice up the bean burger.  The bean burger was dry and arrived with no sauce or toppings except lettuce and tomato.  We ate just to eat,  tipped and were left with a feeling..nice place for a nice drink and a chat if you are near The Westin, but other than that...prepare to be bored.

Eg7G1wzHHlJNfJwL8rYtUw.text: what a great experience! downtown really needed this: boutique hotel and great dinning!  I went there for lunch and we each ordered an entree: salmon, steak, and bbq pork. They were each delicious. I can't decide what I liked the best. I really enjoyed the artichoke hearts with my steak however, the bbq pork was to die for. Since I am a dessert lover we ordered the Peanut Butter and Chocolate one and the Peach Tart. Both were delicious..the peanut butter chocolate one was sooo rich, you should probably split it!  I'll definitely be back...thank you Province!

pRhnBTtUiD-7x1O6Ij2w-Q.text: Very nice atmosphere. The service was friendly and prompt. We ordered wine, appetizers, entrees and dessert. The espresso creme brulee was delicious. Well worth a try if you're in the area.

CSPDVKwfv-LSDL8qvc_nMw.text: I hosted a group dinner for 10 people at Province a few weeks ago.  We sat on the patio on a gorgeous night.  Our visit started off a little shaky, but they quickly rebounded.  We really enjoyed the food and the service was good.  I love that they have wine on tap - yummy!

wLZP9siO_5r8E9Q7oSXO3w.text: hotel restaurants are almost always disappointing and this was no exception.  the food is not fresh and out of the six things i got to sample i was disappointed with every single one of them.  the burger was really boring, lettuce and tomatoes looked like cafeteria food.  the salmon appetizer was inedible.  the tortillas on the shrimp tacos were stale.  not surprisingly, it was also overpriced.  in fairness the service was actually GREAT.  our waitress was very attentive and helpful.  i jokingly suggested baja fresh on the walk over and kinda wish we had gone there instead.

5-BxXeLQSpbF_bOY_suK8Q.text: I decided to give province another try and I was pleasantly surprised. As usual, their wine collection was fabulous. The waiter I had was extremely courteous and helpful, making it an overall fantastic experience.  Instead of starting with apps, I decided to try small portions of the Pan Seared Rare Hawaiian Tuna and the House made Papardelle Pasta (I love the fact that they have small / big portions for some of their entrees!). The tuna was delicious. It had the right amount of lemony zest and the romesco sauce was outstanding. this is def one of my favorite dishes.   The pasta was fresh and tasty. I loved the mix of mushrooms and monchego.  Having been to quite  a few of the restaurants in phoenix, i will say that province is right up there with the best!

h4CfvkAa_wKT43JI0qu2bA.text: Another wonderful evening hosted by Yelp & Lindsey F! I'd never been to Province (or the Westin Downtown) for that matter and was pleasantly suprised by what was there. The patio setting was beautiful, the food & drink were all delicious and the staff couldn't have been more friendly. We'll be telling our friends about Province and will be back!

uAoSMJtDV7Zofd1donv-sQ.text: I love the decor....clean, modern with a creative flair. The service was fantastic....informative, friendly and not in-your-face. The food was AWESOME! The best crab cake I've ever had! I've had better ceviche, but that's ok. The burger was nice and juicy, tender on a brioche bun. The small plate of bread with the white bean puree was full of flavor as well. We will definitely go back! Need to try the desserts!!

iF9gNG6n7pVu1BxC0zTGlQ.text: Went for an early dinner before a show, pretty nice looking room. The service was kind if slow , seemed like they were understaffed, but when we got our food things got better. Had the choriso and cheese dip, very creamy and tasty. Then we shared the saffron rice shrimp dish, plenty to share and very good. The drinks were decent, so overall a nice experience.

c6jx5qqOlCVgZII710jCgw.text: Province, at the Westin Phoenix is a pretty standard American menu, with some very interesting Spanish twists, and a somewhat awkward dining room. We dined for lunch and had a roller coaster ride of a meal. Our server answered many questions with "I don't know" and never offered to find the answer, so we were left with nothing to go on. His stumbles through his pre ordering "speech," which sounded like he was reading from a script, were pathetic. Not his fault if they make him recite something verbatim, but I don't want to eat at a place where the servers are doing that, there is no connection whatsoever.   We tried the flatbread with Chorizo and Manchego which was fantastic, the papperdelle which was great as well, and even the squash sandwich, which was probably my favorite. Per the servers recommendation, I tried the "out of this world" hamburger. It certainly was not "out of this world" as he so proclaimed. Actually, it was pathetic. The nuked piece of meat, lack of ANY sort of condiment, and only a leaf of lettuce and a slice of tomato made this a dry as a piece of cardboard abortion of a burger. Upon telling our server, he said "oh yeah, we have a cook who likes to cook things a little longer." That's not an acceptable answer, dude... and if the guy is that bad at cooking, then he needs to be taught to cook to a standard. A side note here, we light salt, but found everything to be completely doused in salt, almost to the point where it was overwhelming. Regarding this, our server did tell us a cook in the kitchen is heavy handed. Dude why are you guys not training these people? And why are you throwing your co workers under the bus?  I'll go back here after a while when they can work out some kinks. As for the atmosphere though, it's a big empty room, with nothing interesting inside. They have some corporate'y "art" on the walls that looks uninteresting, and a huge open space in the middle of the dining room that desparately needs something done with it.

mbSbLXOpmfHBjscgt1wdoQ.text: I'm a little late to the party review... but this was hands down the best Elite party so far this year!  All the food was unique and amazing. My favorite was the goat cheese fondue and homemade corn nuts... yum! I would have left happy with the incredible food and glorious sangrias, but then they went and brought out desserts... O to the M to the G... you had me at chocolate Ganache and cinnamon churros! Thank you Yelp, and Province for hosting this event.  I am looking forward to going back to Province and  sitting down to a whole bowl of goat cheese fondue to myself =P.

UTOS2wr6es51rAoF4ucOJQ.text: Did you know province has happy hour everyday (7 days a week) from 4pm to 6:30pm? And they have some killer deals during happy hour.  Province is inside The Westin, and since I was already staying the night, I decided to pop on in to province during happy hour to give them a try.  After checking out the happy hour menu I went with the cocktail of the day ($7), which was a watermelon mojito. If you were to imagine a perfect beautiful summer day, this cocktail would match that feeling, it was cool and refreshing and had a little kick it to and for $7 bucks, I had 2!  For the bites, I ordered the poutine, which during happy hour is a bangin good deal ($6). It was thick cut fries, gravy, chorizo, cotija and roasted green chili, these were amazing! So dang good! Almost licked the pan clean haha.  If you are looking for a great chill place for happy hour, go give province a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0y9uPPJ7MWBEKSemvJa0qg.text: Was heading to the opera, and Province was the closest place 9 of us could get reservations.  OK, my thoughts:  They have valet parking, but, trust me, plan to pay $12, cause you will definitely go over your free first 3 hours.  No big deal, and the parkers are nice guys. Now the food, I had the steak for $36 which is a petite filet mignon over something I couldn't identify along with a reddish-orange sauce.  Good, filling and probably the best thing there as both the receptionist and waitress suggested it. My son had the swordfish which he said was good, but it looked more like a patty of swordfish to me.  Regardless, he said it was good just not great. Conclusion:  Get the petite filet mignon. Not a fantastic meal--but a good, filling one cooked very well--so, we wouldn't hesitate to go there again. Service was great, too.  We called and told them we were heading to the opera, so couldn't handle the meal being too late.  They did exactly what we asked.  No complaints at all with the service. Word of caution:  If you go to Province before a show like we were, make a reservation.  The place was packed!  Latecomers were stuck eating on those high chairs at the bar--not comfy looking to me.

dz7srG6lIicrtwcFDfBIPg.text: I went to province  for lunch during a workday. The venue is very elegant and feels upscale but the prices are rather reasonable  for lunch. We had a reservation, so we were seated right away.   We ended up being 7 people instead of 6 and it was no big deal, another chair was added to the table and orders were taken. I ordered the chicken flautas , which are a re-imagined version of traditional chicken flautas. They use blue corn, which was an exciting change. the flautas were packed with  chicken, which seemed a bit un-seasoned, and came on top of lettuce (traditionally the lettuce is on top) . On top of the flautas there was a creamy avocado sauce  thing, which I thought was good but felt paltry , would have been great to have more sauce on the side.  The flautas come with a side, and I ordered sweet potato fries, which is a weird combination with flautas, but they were pretty great and I regret nothing.  Overall I enjoyed my experience and I applaud the creativity of the chef to re-invent a traditional dish. I would be interested to try more of their menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken flautas

Eu_ez0OCcvJZgx9yUQUmEw.text: It was my birthday weekend. I tend to not want a big fuss on my birthday, but other people usually have other ideas. I usually surrender, as it is a great opportunity for me to get together with the 5 most amazing women in my life (my wife and my 4 daughters).  My daughters had heard great things about this particular restaurant, located within the Westin Hotel, on the corner of Central Avenue and Van Buren. So, they wanted us to go have Sunday Brunch to celebrate my birthday.  It was a quiet Sunday morning at Province. I counted two groups seated at the patio, and no one was in the main dining room. There were two gentlemen seated at the bar, but they weren' eating.  We had a two-hour window for Brunch, as I had tickets to the Cardinals game all the way across town. We were seated promptly at 11 AM. Sadly, after that, our issues began.  Although we were given our menus immediately, and our drink orders were taken, it took close to 20 minutes for our server to actually bring our drinks. Then, it was ultimately close to 45 minutes before our food actually arrived.   Our server apologized profusely for the delays, in between her harried tasks of taking care of the tables at the patio, and a couple who now was seated behind us in the main dining room. We were understanding, but we all thought that perhaps they were short handed as our server seemed to have been taking care of all the tables.   Don't get me wrong, the food was fantastic. All our meals were cooked to perfection. My Steak and Eggs was wonderfully prepared. The grilled steak was cooked to my liking - medium well, and well marinated. The potato hash that came with the dish was tender inside but also had a  crunchy exterior. The Pancakes had amazingly flavorful blueberries. We also ordered the Sonoran Eggs Benedict, which had a delightfully spicy chorizo as part of its ingredients. It really did come alive within our palates. Yes, we do share food amongst each other as most families do. It's just an efficient way to sample the variety of dishes.  However, by the time we got out of there, it was past 1 PM, and I wound up being late for the start of the football game.  I'm really not sure what happened there that morning. But, it didn't leave a good impression with any of us. My daughters voiced their regret about deciding on this spot. I allayed their concern, stating that it was more important for us to get together once in a while; than it is for us to be flustered by lapses in service at an establishment such as this.  It's unfortunate because upon reviewing the recent reviews, it appears that my review may be one of the few 3-star reviews or less, of late.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and Eggs
Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonora Eggs Benedict
Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry Pancake

-ZbnmNeh5dYyjBCPY5talQ.text: The bar here was very nice.  I wish there was more seating, however.  I had to sit facing a wall, but it was fine.  The bartender made every effort to ensure I was not forgotten back there.  I ordered his signature drink which I cannot remember the name for the life of me.  It was exquisite.  The beer fondue was delicious.  I couldn't get enough.  Really nice spot and great ambiance.  Wish I had more time in Phoenix to go back and try breakfast or dinner here.

4q5m45DcdDi-GozCBkf1kw.text: While there are a not a wide variety of vegan options here, the outstanding customer service (and convenient location) keep drawing me back to Province. On my first visit, I think my vegan options were the standard "fries and a salad" but I got sweet potato fries instead. The server suggested he bring me a side of maple syrup for the fries. I raise an eyebrow, but once I tried it, I was an addict.   On my most recent visit, my friend and I needed a quiet place to chat, drink tons of coffee and have a light snack in the mid-morning. The restaurant was quiet and comfortable, and the coffee was delicious. They even had soy milk! My friend got the mixed fruit and berries, which were beautiful, and I ordered a side of hash browns cooked well done. A few minutes after ordering, a person who seemed to be a manager came out and said they only have a "house potato trio" and asked if that would be okay. I thought that was sweet and let her know any kind of crispy salty potatoes were fine by me! The potatoes were perfect and the fruit and berries were gorgeous.  We never saw the bottom of our coffee mugs, and before we left, the manager/server came back and offered us some "cold beverages to go" so we got two iced teas! Needless to say, we got the caffeine fix we needed, and then some!

W5Zg-8-p4hhGVzIt8l46bQ.text: Driving by this place all the time I thought it was about time to check it out.  Went the morning of my birthday after getting off work (work nights) and it was a surprise.  It hosts a lot of business folk, which makes sense, since we are downtown. They do have good food and the servers were professional which was interesting since the group we were in are slightly loud and obnoxious.  Due to our celebrations they gave us a granola platter for the table.  We also ordered mimosas along with breakfast. They were a bit on the pricey side for the size but she did note that the champagne was plenty and the juice was just for color.    I ordered and shared a chilaquiles dish with their pancake of the month which happened to be a Reese's peanut butter pancake (delicious - who doesn't love peanut butter?)  It was a good time since we were going for a celebration but I don't know that I could go there on the regular.  It was a bit expensive. As a side note the girls who woke up way too early to spend time I want to say thank you to.  It made me feel special for you to show up.

photos.caption: Photo of Province Urban Kitchen & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday breakfast with the girls!!

mV0sxl-KMe_6VKYZzZnWgA.text: We've been coming here for over a year now. Always consistent, unique, and healthy cuisine. Great cocktails.  Better than your typical Hotel atmosphere. Breakfast is always better attended than dinner, but the food is equally good for each meal.

uUHreU4hZj8Z3uEJQ55HeQ.text: Tyler at the bar is so awesome! Really remembers each of the people that come in regularly and what they want, and is a super killer bartender!! Food is great.

1kKR3uWgn5STmosblojNWg.text: This establishment is connected to the WESTIN HOTEL and i must say lodging at the WESTIN was a treat. The service and the food at this Resturant was great as well. We really enjoyed drinking and dinning at this Resturant.

VbJVWuura6IMxWbFdX00gg.text: We recently stopped at the downtown Phoenix Westin Province Bar for drinks and a quick meal. Nice spot, valet parking and both indoor and outdoor seating - modern decor.  On the inside you have a choice of tables & chairs, booth seating or you can utilize the bar stools. We were there late afternoon and the place was quiet when we arrived but business started to pick-up as our meal progressed.  We selected a booth in the bar area and were "well" served by the bar tender. My wife ordered a Sonoma Cutrer Chardonnay and I asked for a glass of Bordeaux. They were both very drinkable, in fact, I ended up ordering a second round for myself. Then we selected several small plates. These included cauliflower croquettes, filet & NY tips, fried green tomatoes, salmon cakes and a watermelon salad.    We cleaned our plates - everything was tasty and fresh. I was surprised to find that the cauliflower was my favorite. I would definitely order this again.  Prices were competitive, service was very good and the food (based on what we tried) was delicious. I recommend.
